dt: {bc}a vertical arrangement of items printed or written on a page
{bc}one of two or more vertical sections of a printed page separated by a rule or blank space

dt.t: The news article takes up three {wi}columns{/wi}.

dt: {bc}one in a usually regular series of newspaper or magazine articles
{bc}one consisting of a usually round shaft, a capital, and a base
{bc}something resembling a column in form, position, or function
{bc}a tube or cylinder in which a chromatographic separation takes place
{bc}one of the vertical lines of elements of a {d_link|determinant|determinant} or {d_link|matrix|matrix}

dt.t: put another game in the win {wi}column{/wi}

et: Middle English {it}columne{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}columpne{/it}, from Latin {it}columna{/it}, from {it}columen{/it} top; akin to Latin {it}collis{/it} hill {ma}{mat|hill|}{/ma}
shortdef: a vertical arrangement of items printed or written on a page
one of two or more vertical sections of a printed page separated by a rule or blank space

dt: {bc}a newspaper column of personal advertisements relating especially to missing relatives or friends

dt: {bc}a group of secret sympathizers or supporters of an enemy that engage in espionage or sabotage within defense lines or national borders

et: name applied to rebel sympathizers in Madrid in 1936 when four rebel columns were advancing on the city
shortdef: a group of secret sympathizers or supporters of an enemy that engage in espionage or sabotage within defense lines or national borders
a concrete-filled cylindrical steel structural column

dt: {bc}the axial skeleton of a vertebrate that consists of an articulated series of vertebrae which extend from the neck to the tail and protect the spinal cord

shortdef: the axial skeleton of a vertebrate that consists of an articulated series of vertebrae which extend from the neck to the tail and protect the spinal cord —called also backbone, vertebral column

dt: {bc}the column that encloses the connections to the steering gear of a vehicle (such as an automobile)

shortdef: the column that encloses the connections to the steering gear of a vehicle (such as an automobile)

dt: {bc}a vertical expanse of water stretching between the surface and the floor of a body of water

dt.t: Shallow feeders, sea lions work the top 600 feet of the {wi}water column{/wi} for hake, rock-fish, herring, sardines … and squid, but opportunistically capturing anything that happens by.

Only a few animals of the {wi}water column{/wi} above would have died and settled into the sediments below during the short time when the mudslide was coalescing into a layer of sediment in the stagnant basin.

dt: {bc}a vertical pipe with valves and spout for delivering water to a locomotive tender

shortdef: a vertical expanse of water stretching between the surface and the floor of a body of water
a vertical pipe with valves and spout for delivering water to a locomotive tender

dt: {bc}an article in a newspaper or magazine that offers advice to people who write to ask for help with a problem

shortdef: an article in a newspaper or magazine that offers advice to people who write to ask for help with a problem

dt: {bc}a special section of a newspaper, magazine, etc., where people can place short personal messages

shortdef: a special section of a newspaper, magazine, etc., where people can place short personal messages
